case_title: ABDUL AZIZ AND 5 Others vs THE STATE
case_number: Criminal Appeal No. 376 and Murder Reference No. 169 of 1971

sentence.sentence: Death and fine of Rs. 2,000 each on each count
Transportation for life and fine of Rs. 2,000 each on two counts

incident_details.location: Sheep and Goat Market (Bakkar Mandi), Lahore
incident_details.description: Double murder allegedly committed by the appellants using firearms.

key_points.initial_report: Filed by Nawab Din at Police Station Nawankot at 4:15 PM.

victim_1.name: Elahi Bakhsh
victim_1.cause_of_death: Cardio-respiratory failure due to firearm injuries
victim_1.injuries: Pellet injuries caused by a gun.

victim_2.name: Inayat
victim_2.cause_of_death: Haemorrhage and shock due to firearm injuries

key_points.police_version: Suggested self-defense by Taj Din and Shafiq, leading to charges under section 304, P.P.C.
key_points.complaint_version: Filed by Muhammad Hanif, alleging deliberate murder by all six appellants.
court_findings: Conflict between medical evidence and ocular testimony.
Police investigation found biased and unreliable.
No disinterested witnesses presented by the complainant.

judgment_summary.appeal_decision: Convictions and sentences of all appellants set aside.
judgment_summary.release_order: Appellants to be released if not required in any other case.
